page.title: 06 Work on a Keith farm
page.content: At 7a.m. I walked into the big shed.In this shed is stored the winter feed for the cattle.The farm tractors and machinery are also kept here. Climbing up the steps into the cab of the Massey Ferguson 4-wheel drive tractor, I saw that the other tractors had already gone.I switched on the engine and speeding down the road,with the Claas forage harvester behind,I turned into the already cut grass field.I waited for the other tractor to come alongside with the Weeks cart.I switched on the power drive and moved forward.As we worked our way around the field,the forage harvester filled the cart with the chopped grass.When full,the grass was taken back to the farm to be dumped in a pit and left to ferment.This makes it into silage which is used as winter feed for the cattle.
